title: How many square feet are 9 feet 7 inches x 3 feet 6 inches? - Quora

response.answer_text: When dealing with mixed variables, like feet and inches, I try to express them in one variable, either square feet or square inches, then convert the answer to the units that were asked for, as a final step. It’s much less confusing that way, especially when you’re dealing with numbers in base 12. The reason that the Metric system is SO much easier to work with is that it’s in base ten. Want to multiply or divide by 10? Easy, just move the decimal. The numbers we’re dealing with, here, are not going to translate to whole feet, so we will work in inches. 9′ 7″ = 115″ and 3′ 6″ = 42″. The question asks for Area; the formula for Area is A = L X W. 115″ X 42″ = 4,830 in². We have our answer, but since the question specifies an answer in square feet, we will have to convert in². to ft². There are 144 in² per ft². 4,830 in² ÷ 144 in² = 33.54166667 ft² or 33 ft² 78 in². Either answer is correct, but I think it best, clearer to give the remaining area in the exact number of in², rather than as 0.54166667 ft². But it might be even better to give the remaining square inches in both forms, if you’re dealing with an instructor who is highly precise; after all, the question DOES specify ‘square feet’. Perhaps the answer with square feet would be better for the instructor; the answer with the exact number of square inches would certainly be more useful to the Carpenter or other craftsman who has to deal with his project.

In the rectangle: Area = Length x Width. Length = 9 feet 7 inches. Width = 3 feet 6 inches. Convert Length 9*(12)+7 = 115 inches. Convert Width 3*(12) +6 = 42 inches. Area = Length x Width. Area = 115 * 42 inches. Area = 4830 inches. Convert area to square feet: 4830 inches/144 = 33.54166666666666667 Therefore there are approximately 33.5416 square feet in an object 9 feet 7 inches by 3 feet 6 inches.
